experience: You and Michelle both know Sean Sheppard, Luke Hohmann, and 34 others
.@okta has been recognized as a Leader in identity across top industry research! Proud to be part of the team making it happen:
“I made it to 11 final round interviews and generated 1 interview.” -job seeker
Question: Why do you think only 1 of 11 final interviews turned into an offer for this job seeker?

Millions of people rely on Okta every day to securely connect with the technologies and services that let them do their most important work.  Identity is Always On, and so are we. We built the Okta service for high availability and a guaranteed uptime.My main focus is to ensure that the recruiting function is well aligned with the vision and goals of the organization.  My team owns "all things recruiting" and "all things immigration" across all departments for Okta. This includes headcount planning, forecasting capabilities, talent pipeline strategy, executing against aggressive hiring targets, reporting, employment branding, diversity efforts, and university programs. We also own all inbound immigration as well as global outbound immigration efforts. We believe we are solving some extremely big problems. If you'd like to join a group of amazing humans who thrive on making customers—and each other—successful, please reach out!

I managed an amazing team executing on aggressive hiring targets across R&D, Sales, and Operations and developed scalable recruiting process across our San Francisco, Vancouver, Tempe, and Bangalore locations.  Partnered closely with Finance for Headcount planning and reconciliation, owned employer branding efforts, University/Intern programs, and diversity efforts including a strong commitment to Veteran Hiring.  https://www.zenefits.com/blog/joiningforces/

Managed a team of 20 who lead the growth of the Zenefits Engineering team in three locations (SF, Vancouver, Bangalore) from 30 to 200+ engineers in a year, quadrupled the size of our Product team, built the IT and Security teams from scratch, and created process and intuitive headcount plans where there were none previously. We significantly improved offer acceptance rate, onsite to offer ratio, and executed a series of global Hackathons which led to 1500 participants and 12 hires in 10 days in the first run.  Contributed significantly to Recruiting Operations for the overall growth of Zenefits from ~300 employees to 2000+ employees.

I had the exciting job of developing and executing on global recruiting programs for AdRoll. That included Recruiting Operations, University Recruiting, Systems/Technology and Reporting, Events, Employer Branding, Process Improvement, and everything in between for our offices in San Francisco, New York, Dublin, London, Tokyo, and Sydney, during a high growth period. I managed a small, but mighty, Recruiting Operations team and planned and executed the successful migration of our Applicant Tracking system from beginning to end.  I championed and launched the first ever recruitment retargeting campaign in collaboration with Marketing, making use of the AdRoll product for Recruiting.  I built and solidified processes for Recruiting Operations, Creative partnership, and HR handoff.  My team represented AdRoll at multiple University Events, Technical Conferences, and Open House branding events.

I was responsible for “all things recruiting” at Atlassian in San Francisco. I began as the first recruiter in San Francisco and managed the growth in that office from ~100 to over 300 people.  I supported client groups based in both San Francisco, CA and Sydney, Australia.  Later, I was promoted, and managed recruitment for our offices in Amsterdam and Japan and helped to staff and mentor recruiters in a remote shared services location in Manila. I was also responsible for managing a small recruiting team, coordinating day-to-day recruiting efforts, developing scalable recruitment processes, managing recruiting projects, partnership with FP&A, and helping to "paint the picture" of the larger recruitment strategy. If it related to recruiting in any way, I was involved.

recommendations: October 12, 2016, Whitney reported directly to Michelle

I would say it is pretty rare to have the opportunity to report to someone who is a leader, coach, and mentor all in one - but I did when I worked with Michelle. Michelle took a chance on me coming into the recruiting world with not very much experience. However, during my time under Michelle’s wing, I feel like a veteran! Over the past year and half, I have had the pleasure of working directly with her to create process in the midst of chaos, analyze (& understand!) recruiting metrics, clean up and revamp a recruiting organization, and “move the needle” on large scale recruiting projects to impact the business. Michelle is a wealth of knowledge and I was always amazed at her ability to ask her direct reports the right questions to promote learning and development within our team. Not only that - but she did all this while managing a family (hello, PTA meetings!), a killer workout schedule, and guest speaking at recruiting conferences. As a manager myself, I can only hope that I bring a fraction of what Michelle brings to the table! Any team is lucky to have her!

September 19, 2016, Tracy reported directly to Michelle

Michelle is a phenomenal leader. After starting at Zenefits, we both quickly realized the type of challenges and problems we were facing were extremely unique - and extremely complicated. She is quick to organize and rally her team and has an amazing ability to make sense of all the chaos. She's a fantastic manager and is always willing to roll up her sleeves and dive in wherever help is needed. I feel lucky to have been managed by someone who really gets everything there is to know about recruiting.

Executive Assistant to the General Counsel at Snap Inc.

I worked with Kristen at AdRoll and then had the good fortune to also work with her at Zenefits.  Kristen is a sponge.  She wants to grow and learn more than almost anyone I have ever worked with and when she takes things on, she's thoughtful and diligent in her approach and follow through.  She likes to be challenged and driven and is always taking on more.  Aside from that, she's a general pleasure to be around, has a great attitude, and is always doing her best to elevate those around her.....she's a team player.  I've really enjoyed working with Kristen and watching her continue to grow into meatier roles and think any company would be lucky to have her.

Working with Tracy has been a real pleasure.  Our growth targets have been significantly higher than what either she or I had experienced prior to joining Zenefits, and her ability to deliver in a high pressure, high volume environment has been remarkable.  She's easily been my "right hand man" while managing our Engineering growth, and has naturally taken on the lead role in training and ramping all of our new team members.  She works very well with our executive team and they trust her as much as I do to get things done well.  I've rarely come across a recruiter like Tracy and feel fortunate to have managed her and had her help in tackling this amazing growth.  I don't think we could have been nearly as successful without her.

summary: I'm passionate about People.  I believe that striving to be the best and having a positive impact on people and companies is important. I believe in biting off a little more than you can chew and then figuring out how to make it work. I believe in doing the right thing. I believe in “being the change you seek.”  I believe that the smartest people share, collaborate, and elevate themselves and those around them. I believe in high fives and honest conversations and community building.  HR and Recruiting should be about creating and implementing optimal processes and solutions that make it possible and rewarding for people to do the greatest work of their lives; about creating environments that remind people why they chose their careers and what they love about their work.   It should be about hiring the right people, and leveraging the right data, to take a company from “great” to “off-the-charts amazing," and finding that perfect balance between the “human element” and a successfully run business.
name: Michelle Delcambre
title: Head of Global Talent Acquisition at Okta, Inc.
